ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned composition and experimentation with different mediums and materials to create art. Learned to develop my own strengths into an emerging distinct personal style
Learned how to use different materials  like charcoal and colored pencils. Tried different styles of art like college and still lives
I learned how to loosen up my drawing hand, leave my perfectionism behind, and embrace different forms of creating art both individually and in a group.

I developed my art and drawing skills much more through this class. Understanding how to approach drawings, and the use of color and various medium. Overall, great introduction to drawing and art in general.
I had never drawn in a formal setting before, and I definitely gained a much greater skill level at drawing and also appreciation of decisions made in the creation of art.
I loved this course! It was great exploring drawing and the process of creating art. My drawing definitely improved and I have a better understanding of different materials and how to use them.
I have been able to improve my drawing skills as well as being able to interpret and discuss art.

We learned really great observational skills and how to make detailed set. We go beyond traditional drawing and experiment with a range of mediums which allows greater exploration of individual process.
introduction to figure drawings, still life, and mixed media. Basic drawing skills and how to use a wide variety of materials like charcoal and graphite.
drawing in charcoal, pencil, colored pencil. working collaboratively with a group. collage. how to critique and receive feedback on art.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Lots of feedback and encouragement. Might have appreciated more demonstrations on drawing techniques
Great course. No weaknesses. Matt does a great job of letting you explore and find out which materials and styles you like the best
I loved how much time we had in class to work and get/give feedback. I also enjoyed the crit format for seeing classmates' art work.

I enjoyed the flexibility of the course, and have the opportunity to try different things often other than just drawing from a still life. I also enjoyed crits as they gave valuable feedback and allowed us to see the work everyone else was doing.
I think there could be a bit more instruction on the fundamentals of drawing.
great intro course, Matt does a really good job of making it accessible for non majors. You learn a lot. Slightly tough grading.

strengths are very creative class, open to all skill level, personalized feedback and a lot of attention to your work, collaborate class environments. weaknesses are that it seems we almost spent more time in critiques than we did drawing, which i wish wasnt the case.

strengths: good cadence of assignments, clear feedback, good communication 
weaknesses: too much collage near the end of the course

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, a great introductory art course

YES YES. You need to take it if you get in. I was a non art major - Econ- and loved it. How else would you get to make art for homework ? No tests, no stress, just art. It was pretty relaxed. You may stay up late-ish working the day before a critique but thats just a handful of days. The rest of the days there is absolutely no work done outside of class. I found it so fun exploring different mediums like charcoal and just creating pieces that had their own style and look. Cant recommend it enough, especially senior year. Its very cool to experience  art space at Yale too if you never had before
Definitely! Such a great way to do something creative and engaging.
Absolutely! Great class if you have any interest in art or drawing.
Definitely. You do NOT need to have any background in art to enjoy and benefit from this class.

Yes. If you want an intro art class this is great for majors and non majors. Matt is very fair and you will improve and learn a lot. Really fun format and safe space. Great course to take if you have ever wanted to take an art class at yale.
yes, great opportunity to get creative. super fun.
yes, it's a great intro course and is very accessible. it can feel like a lot of work but it takes time to improve drawing skills.
Yes it was excellent
